title: Beyonce declared a billionaire by Forbes magazine
byline: US singer Beyonce is now a billionaire, Forbes magazine said Monday (Dec 29), becoming only the fifth musician to achieve such a milestone.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Northern, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Polonnaruwa districts, today (30), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Trump warns Iran of possible strike, urges Hamas to disarm after meeting Netanyahu
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday the United States could support another major strike on Iran were it to resume rebuilding its ballistic missile or nuclear weapons programs and warned Hamas of severe consequences if it does not disarm.

title: Cyclone Ditwah caused Rs. 21 bln loss to Sri Lanka’s health sector – Minister
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, stated that Sri Lanka’s national health system has incurred losses amounting to Rs. 21 billion as a result of the impact of Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Special traffic and security plan in Colombo for New Year 2026 celebrations
byline: Sri Lanka Police state that a large number of people and vehicles are expected to arrive in Colombo from outlying areas to celebrate the New Year 2026 tomorrow (31), particularly around the Galle Face Green area.

title: Two generators at Norochcholai power plant under repair
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said that two generators at the Lakvijaya Coal Power Plant in Norochcholai are currently out of service due to repair work.

title: Saudi Arabia bombs Yemen over shipment of weapons for separatists that arrived from UAE
byline: Saudi Arabia bombed the port city of Mukalla in Yemen on Tuesday over what it described as a shipment of weapons for a separatist force there that arrived from the United Arab Emirates. The UAE did not immediately acknowledge the strike.

title: Bangladesh’s first female prime minister, Khaleda Zia, dies at 80
byline: Bangladesh’s first female prime minister, Khaleda Zia, died after a prolonged illness, her opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party said on Tuesday.

title: 4 dead, 9 injured after bus hits pedestrians in Mumbai’s Bhandup
byline: Four people were killed and nine others injured after they were hit by a BEST bus in Mumbai on Monday. The incident happened in Mumbai’s Bhandup around 10 pm, officials said.

title: NDDCB reports uptick in ‘Ice’ users in Sri Lanka; Over 60,000 addicts arrested in first 10 months of 2025
byline: The National Dangerous Drugs Control Board (NDDCB) has reported a rise in the use of the narcotic substance crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’), in Sri Lanka.

title: Minister reveals reasons for increase in illegal gemstone exports in Sri Lanka
byline: Minister of Industry, Sunil Handunnetti, stated that there has been a noticeable increase in the illegal export of gemstones from Sri Lanka.

title: IMF delegation to visit Sri Lanka in first half of next year
byline: A delegation from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka during the first half of next year.

title: Galle MC meeting adjourned following heated opposition protests
byline: A tense situation has unfolded today (30) during a special general meeting of the Galle Municipal Council.

title: Ex-SJB councillor arrested for assaulting former NPP candidate in Dodangoda
byline: A former Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Pradeshiya Sabha member has been arrested by the Dodangoda Police for allegedly assaulting a former National People’s Power (NPP) Local Government candidate in Dodangoda.

title: Rajarata University lecturers launch strike
byline: The lecturers of the Rajarata University have withdrawn from all duties today (30) and commenced a strike action.

title: Former Minister Johnston Fernando’s son arrested
byline: Johan Fernando, the son of former Minister Johnston Fernando, has been arrested today (30) by the Financial Crimes Investigation Department (FCID), police confirmed.

title: Sri Lanka’s Parliament passed 26 bills in 2025
byline: The Department of Communication of Parliament stated that the Parliament of Sri Lanka has passed a total of 26 Government Bills during the one-year period from 01 January 2025 to 31 December 2025, during the first session of the Tenth Parliament.

title: Chairman of Ganga Ihala Korale PS granted bail
byline: The NPP Chairman of the Ganga Ihala Korale Pradeshiya Sabha, Indika Upul Gunasekera, who was arrested in connection with an alleged assault incident, has been released on bail.

title: Meta to buy Chinese startup Manus to boost advanced AI
byline: Meta said on Monday it would acquire Chinese artificial intelligence startup Manus as the technology giant accelerates efforts to integrate advanced AI across its platforms.

title: Renowned Indian filmmaker Prabhu Deva arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: SriLankan Airlines announced that it had the honour of welcoming the renowned Indian film director, actor, dancer, and choreographer, Prabhu Deva, on board a flight from Chennai to Colombo.

title: Flood damage assessment to major and medium-sized rivers to begin next month
byline: The Department of Irrigation has directed its attention to conducting a comprehensive assessment of the damage caused to river basins, tanks, and anicuts due to the recent flood situation resulting from heavy rainfall across Sri Lanka.

title: China fires rockets towards Taiwan in war games simulating blockade
byline: China fired rockets toward Taiwan on Tuesday and deployed new amphibious assault ships alongside bomber aircraft and warships to encircle the island on the second day of its most extensive war games aimed at rehearsing a blockade.

title: Nallur PS member arrested with stock of Kerala cannabis
byline: A member of the Nallur Pradeshiya Sabha has been arrested in the Chemmani area of Jaffna while in possession of a stock of Kerala cannabis.

title: Fire breaks out at two shops in Kiribathgoda
byline: UPDATE: Heavy traffic congestion has been reported along the Kandy-Colombo road in Kiribathgoda after the fire broke out at two shops.

title: Sri Lankan-born Prof. Nishan Canagarajah knighted in 2026 King’s New Year Honours
byline: University of Leicester’s President and Vice-Chancellor Professor Nishan Canagarajah has been knighted in the 2026 King’s New Year Honours.

title: Colombo-Kandy road temporarily closed for traffic at Kiribathgoda
byline: The Colombo-Kandy main road has been temporarily closed for traffic at Kiribathgoda due to a fire in two shops.

title: Govt seeks to expand agreement with Israel to deploy additional workers
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to expand the agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Israel signed to deploy workers within two more sectors in Israel.

title: Fairly heavy rainfalls about 75 mm likely in several provinces tomorrow
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the Northern, Eastern, Central, Northcentral and Uva provinces and in Hambantota district tomorrow (31), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Alleged Bondi gunmen acted alone and did not train in the Philippines, police say
byline: The two alleged gunmen who killed 15 people at a Jewish event on Bondi Beach were not part of a wider terror cell and acted alone, Australian police have said.

title: Matugama PS Secretary hospitalised following alleged assault by Chairman
byline: The Chairman of the Matugama Pradeshiya Sabha, which is controlled by the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), has allegedly assaulted the Secretary of the same local council.

title: China’s Communist Party pledges RMB 1 mln in relief supplies to Sri Lanka
byline: The Communist Party of China (CPC) will provide relief assistance worth RMB 1 million to Sri Lanka, the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka has announced.

title: Tax relief for imported dates in view of Ramadan fasting
byline: The government has decided to provide tax relief for imported dates received as donations or gifts in view of the upcoming Ramadan fasting period.

title: Cabinet nod to increase financial relief provided for entrepreneurs affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The government has decided to introduce a new loan scheme named ‘Comprehensive disaster relief loan scheme’ to provide working capital loan facilities to micro, small scale and large scale entrepreneurs affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Four new automatic clearance gates to be installed at BIA
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the installation of additional automatic passenger clearance gates at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Ex-Minister Douglas Devananda admitted to Mahara Prison Hospital
byline: Former Minister Douglas Devananda, who was arrested and remanded, has been admitted to the Mahara Prison Hospital.

title: Govt decides to liquidate Sahasya Investment Company
byline: The government has decided to liquidate the Sahasya Investment Company which was established with the objective of maintaining highways, determining strategic methods for further development of the expressways and utilizing modern technologies to minimize costs to maintain the expressways.

title: FR filed over alleged failure to take measures to minimize disaster caused by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition has been filed before the Supreme Court by an attorney from Kandy over the alleged failure by authorities to take necessary measures to minimize the disaster caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Public consultation begins on National Electricity Policy
byline: The process of obtaining public views on the proposed National Electricity Policy is currently underway, according to the Ministry of Energy.

title: Proposal approved to construct teachers quarters at 14 schools in plantation areas
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to implement a project to construct quarters for teachers at 14 selected schools within plantation areas.

title: India authorities undertake strict measures to control avian flu in Kerala
byline: Indian authorities have undertaken strict measures in the southern state of Kerala following the outbreak of bird flu (avian influenza H5N1), officials said Tuesday.

title: President issues stern warning to tax evaders
byline: The law will be enforced without hesitation, irrespective of status against those who attempt to evade taxes, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stated.

title: Ex- Minister Dullas writes to Donald Trump seeking tariff reduction on Sri Lankan imports
byline: Former Minister Dullas Alahapperuma has directed a letter to US President Donald Trump seeking a reduction in tariffs on Sri Lankan imports from the current levels to 12% for a period of one year.

title: China to crack down on AI firms to protect kids
byline: China has proposed strict new rules for artificial intelligence (AI) to provide safeguards for children and prevent chatbots from offering advice that could lead to self-harm or violence.

title: Unit 2 of Norochcholai power plant expected to be reconnected to national grid in two weeks
byline: The two generators undergoing maintenance at the Norochcholai Lakvijaya Coal Power Plant are scheduled to be reconnected to the national power grid on January 14 and January 18, 2026, the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has confirmed.

title: UNP-SJB representatives meet in Colombo
byline: A meeting has taken place between representatives of the United National Party (UNP) and the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB).

title: Auditor General Appointment: Constitutional Council acted beyond its authority - Nalinda
byline: The Constitutional Council has acted beyond its limits, while the President has remained within the constitutional framework during the process to appoint the Auditor General, Cabinet spokesperson Minister Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: Let’s lead Sri Lanka to economic success with new plans in 2026 – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has called on all state officials to work collectively, with renewed plans and strategies, to lead Sri Lanka towards economic success in 2026.

title: Inquiry launched after Grade 6 English language module contained reference to inappropriate website
byline: The distribution of a newly printed Grade 6 English language module has been suspended with immediate effect following the confirmation that it contained a reference to an inappropriate website, the Ministry of Education has announced.

title: Defence Ministry issues notice on firearm license renewal for 2026
byline: The Ministry of Defence has issued a statement on renewing the firearms licenses of individuals and institutions for 2026.

title: India overtakes Japan as fourth-largest economy, report says
byline: India has surpassed Japan to become the world’s fourth-largest economy, according to calculations in the Indian government’s end-of-year economic review.

title: 16-year-old girl injured in shooting in Kohuwala
byline: A 16-year-old girl has been injured and hospitalized following a shooting incident at Bodhiyawatte in Kohuwala, police said.
